meanings.definition: A system of communication using radio waves to transmit messages.
meanings.sent1: The sailors on the ship used a radiotelegraph to send messages to the mainland.
meanings.sent2: The radiotelegraph was an important tool for long-distance communication before the internet.
meanings.sent3: The radiotelegraph beeped and booped like a robot trying to talk.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like a radiotelegraph, sending signals of affection across the airwaves.
meanings.sent5: The radiotelegraph crackled to life, carrying urgent news from afar.

meanings.sent1: The operator would radiotelegraph the coordinates to the rescue team.
meanings.sent2: In the past, people would radiotelegraph Morse code to send messages over long distances.
meanings.sent3: He tried to radiotelegraph his friend across the room using hand signals.
meanings.sent4: Their eyes radiotelegraphed their excitement as they received the good news.
meanings.sent5: The radiotelegraphed message was received loud and clear by the waiting crew.
